title: TACTILE SENSORY DEVICE FOR USE BY A BABY OR CHILD
fig_desc: FIGS. 1 and 2 show a tactile sensory device according to a first embodiment of the invention
all_fig_descs: FIGS. 1 and 2 show a tactile sensory device according to a first embodiment of the invention
A tactile sensory device according to a first embodiment of the invention is shown in FIGS. 1 and 2 and is designated generally by the reference numeral 20
The configuration of the tactile sensory device 20 of FIGS. 1 and 2 therefore results in a baby-friendly grippable ring 20 with an outer shape and an outer texture that feels familiar to the baby

The configuration of the tactile sensory device 20 of FIGS. 1 and 2 as a grippable ring 20 allows the baby to easily hold the tactile sensory device 20 in their hand in the same way a fetus inside the womb holds the umbilical cord in their hand
The tactile sensory device 120 of FIGS. 7 and 8 is similar in structure and operation to the tactile sensory device 20 of FIGS. 1 and 2 and like features share the same reference numerals

The tactile sensory device 120 of FIGS. 7 and 8 differs from the tactile sensory device 20 of FIGS. 1 and 2 in that the tactile sensory device 120 of FIGS. 1 and 2 is configured as a pacifier 120 that is to be placed inside the baby's mouth

Details of the pulsatile waveform of blood flowing in the umbilical cord is the same as described above with reference to the tactile sensory device 20 of FIGS. 1 and 2.Examples of other optional and alternative features of the above embodiments are described as follows
